Relationships.Reason: The copy of the 'Last Supper' by Marco d'Oggiono.
The 'Head of Christ' is the original study for the head of the principal figure in the fresco painting of the 'Last Supper'.
'Head of Christ' is located in Brera Gallery, Milan.
The copy is now in the Diploma Gallery at Burlington House.
Sir Thomas Lawrence advised the Royal Academy to purchase the copy.
Some original studies in red and black chalk are preserved in the Royal Library at Windsor.
Francis I wished to remove the whole wall of the Refectory to Paris.
Constable de Montmorency had a copy made for the Chapel of the Château d'Ecouen.

The copy of the 'Last Supper'...now in the Diploma Gallery at Burlington House
Purchased for £600 by the Royal Academy on the advice of Sir Thomas Lawrence
